p: For the 117 resistant isolates, the TR 46-derived mutations accounted for 79% followed by TR 34-derived mutations (16%). TR 46 3- and TR 46 4-derived mutations were present the least common (âˆ¼5%) ( Table 1). At sampling site B, a larger variety of resistance mechanisms in the samples were found (TR 34, TR 46, TR 46 3, and TR 46 4) compared with the other two sites, where only TR 34 and TR 46 mutations were recovered ( Table 1). TR 46-derived mutations (TR 46/Y121F/T289A) were dominant over the whole sampling period. There were no trends observed in the diversity of resistance mechanisms over time ( Fig. 5).
